reviewText: Same comments apply to series as to the Rebel. Glad to have it my collection it was one of few shows I didn't have the opportunity to see while growing up. I beleive it was produced by the prodution company the produced Bat Masterson and Highway Patrol. I like the series and look forward releases.

reviewText: Two very good dvds on an old TV western series which I loved back in the late 50's. Eight episodes on each disc and the quality is as good as I have seen considering the age of the series. Very happy with them and hope to see future volumes of the series.
Title: N/A

reviewText: After reading other reviews i was not sure what to expect as to quality.I was pleasantly surprised.The quality was not bad at all.This is a great old western series and should bring back memories to many who remember it.
summary: take me back where i wanna be
Title: N/A

reviewText: "Whistle me up a memory, whistle me back to where I wanna be,whistle a tune that will carry me,to Tonbstone Territory.If your past has run afoul of the law, its a lonely place to be,cause your futures just as good as your draw,in Tombstone Territory".  repeat"This is an actual account from the pages of my newspaper the "Tombstone Epitaph"This is the way it happened in the town Too Tough To Die,Tombstone Territory".There are no extras on these 16 episodes on 2 DVD  30 minutes each, the series went from 1957 to 1960, starring Pat Conway as Sherriff Clay Hollister, I am pleased to add them to my largecollection from the period.A couple of episodes show jagged wearing to the right corner, howeverI am still happy to see a young Warren Oates doing his interesting form of acting.From David in Australia whistling with my memories.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I grew up watching shows like "Highway Patrol", "Tombstone Territory", and many others. I always remembered the theme from "Tombstone Territory". With Season 1 Vol. 1 in my collection, I have another piece of television history. I feel young again.

Title: N/A

reviewText: it was a long time dream of getting hold of this very rare video of a television series that i have been waiting for.  the last time i viewed this western was when i was in elementary school circa 1960's ( wow, that old huh )so all through the years i have dreaming of seeing it once again and i did in the year 2010 mind you.  i read one reviewer here in amazon who said that the quality of the picture was outstanding so i immediately bought one without thinking.  but lo and behold when i watched it, that reviewer told a big lie.  the picture was terrible.  the seller should have made a disclosure in his description of the quality of the image.  i would not have complained if they have just told the truth.  do not get me wrong but the story line of the 13 episodes on 2 dvd discs is quite good and the pacing is not boring because it is full of action.  i think that this video was taken from old vhs tapes and transferred to dvd , it must have been transferred several times from different tapes of different generations/sources thus explains the quality of the image.  if you cannot wait to get the original  then you decide if you still want to view these shows now and bear the quality of the picture. the ball is now in your hands.
summary: nice nostalgic material but picture quality is yuchh
Title: N/A

reviewText: Another marvellous early TV western starring Pat Conway as the hard driving no nonsense stalwart sheriff of Tombstone, reputedly the town too tough to died. A very worthy addition for the genuine western fan. It has a catchy tune beginning with " Whistle me up a memory, whistle me up where I want to be, whistle me up a tune of Tombstone Territory." Hopefully other great TV westerns like "Lawman" will also be available to the public soon.
Title: N/A

reviewText: It was good to be able to get this set and revisit one of the many interesting western series which were airing back then.  I found no problems with the product - they show well on my 50" plasma TV.
